[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Authorization bypass] Does prepare() verify that the caller is authorized to decrypt the ciphertext, or can any caller with eval_proofs decrypt any ciphertext? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Key authorization] Can an attacker with a BIBEDecryptionKey for one ciphertext use it to decrypt other ciphertexts they shouldn't access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: CTDecrypt] [Decryption permission] Is there any access control on who can call decrypt(), or can any code with the decryption key decrypt any PreparedCiphertext? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare_individual()] [Proof authorization] Does prepare_individual() verify that the eval_proof was generated for the intended recipient, or can proofs be misused? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Batch inconsistency] If EvalProofs contains proofs for multiple IDs, can mixing proofs between ciphertexts cause incorrect decryption or security bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Missing ID in batch] What happens if a ciphertext's ID is not in eval_proofs - does it fail safely or can partial batches cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: CTEncrypt] [Batch encryption oracle] Can attackers abuse batch encryption to encrypt under multiple IDs simultaneously, creating cross-encryption attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Batch atomicity] Are batch prepare() operations atomic, or can partial failures leave some ciphertexts in inconsistent prepared states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Struct: Ciphertext] [Immutability violation] Can fields of Ciphertext be modified after creation but before verification, bypassing signature checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [State machine bypass] Can attackers skip the prepare() step and directly construct PreparedCiphertext to bypass digest validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Struct: PreparedCiphertext] [Reuse vulnerability] Can a PreparedCiphertext be reused multiple times for decrypt(), and does reuse leak information or cause security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: verify()] [Verification state] Is there any state maintained between verify() calls that could cause TOCTOU vulnerabilities or inconsistent results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt()] [Key length overflow] Can the SECRET_KEY_LENGTH constant be manipulated through type confusion to cause buffer overflows in signing key generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Struct: Ciphertext] [Vec size overflow] Can associated_data_bytes vector grow beyond isize::MAX causing integer overflow in length calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Proof index overflow] Can eval_proofs HashMap operations cause integer overflow when accessing proofs by ID? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Functions: verify() & prepare()] [Verification bypass] Can an attacker call prepare() on an unverified ciphertext, bypassing the security guarantees of verify()? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Functions: encrypt() & decrypt()] [Round-trip inconsistency] Are there inputs that encrypt successfully but fail to decrypt correctly, causing data loss or security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Functions: prepare() & prepare_individual()] [Preparation inconsistency] Can the two preparation methods produce different PreparedCiphertexts for the same input, causing decryption inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Functions: id() & verify()] [ID consistency] Does id() always return the same value as what verify() checks, or can they diverge causing security bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: Eq for Ciphertext] [Equality bypass] Does the Eq implementation properly compare all security-relevant fields, or can unequal ciphertexts be considered equal? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: PartialEq for Ciphertext] [Partial comparison exploit] Can the PartialEq implementation be exploited in sorting or comparison operations to cause security issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: Debug for Ciphertext] [Information leakage] Does the Debug trait implementation leak sensitive information like key material or plaintext data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: Clone for Ciphertext] [Deep copy failure] Does Clone properly deep-copy all nested structures, or can shallow copies lead to aliasing and security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Type: SuccinctCiphertext] [Succinct verification bypass] Does SuccinctCiphertext have weaker verification properties than StandardCiphertext, allowing easier forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Type: SuccinctCiphertext] [Size oracle] Can the difference in size between StandardCiphertext and SuccinctCiphertext leak information about the plaintext or encryption parameters? (Low)
